description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9sitj","text":"This protocol describes the collection, processing, and cryopreservation of pediatric nasal and bronchial brushing samples for downstream single-cell analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"8rd56","text":"This is an experimental protocol for the processing of nasal and bronchial brushing samples collected from children. Sample collection must have and be compliant with Human Ethics Committee approval.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

related_materials.name: Human TruStain FcX™ (Fc Receptor Blocking Solution)
Cytology Brush Single-use Respiratory Compatible Channel - 1.2mm ,  2mm brush width 6mm length

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"efcga","text":"Prepare collection tubes for nasal and bronchial brushing samples by adding 5mL of pre-chilled RPMI supplemented with 2% heat-inactivated fetal calf serum (referred to as RPMI 2% FCS) to a 15mL tube labelled with the study/patient ID.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF NASAL AND BRONCHIAL BRUSHINGS TO SINGLE CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3mets","text":"Filter cell suspension through a 70-120µm cell strainer into a new 15mL tube and centrifuge  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":91,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"300","duration":420,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"9771B8FFE19811EE93350A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

steps.section: CRYOPRESERVATION OF NASAL AND BRONCHIAL BRUSHING CELLS
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7elfk","text":"Resuspend cells at a ratio of 1:1 in RPMI 2% FCS and freeze solution (heat-inactivated FCS + 15% DMSO) such that cells are frozen between 1-10 million cells/mL. Transfer cells to cryogenic vial. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PREPARATION OF FRESH CELLS FOR FLOW CYTOMETRY
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"deldq","text":"Resuspend cell suspension for fixable viability staining according to manufacturers' instructions (e.g. the LIVE/DEAD‱ Fixable Near-IR Stain from Invitrogen/ThermoFisher). steps.section: PROCESSING OF NASAL AND BRONCHIAL BRUSHINGS TO SINGLE CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6v6oe","text":"Repeatedly pipette media onto brushing to dislodge cells. Do this for at least 1 minute\nper brushing.  Remove cytology brush and top up the cell suspension to 10mL with RPMI 2% FCS ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF NASAL AND BRONCHIAL BRUSHINGS TO SINGLE CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6m213","text":"Discard supernatant and resuspend cell pellet in 3mL RPMI 2% FCS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45ggu","text":"Brushing samples must be placed on ice and processed in the laboratory within   of the procedure. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"aj0lh","text":"Immediately place cryogenic vials into an isopropanol freezing container (e.g. Nalgene‱ Mr. Frosty) or Cool Cell (Corning) and transfer to   overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":86,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":139,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3B70EF87E65311EE92B00A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d0hor","text":"For long term storage, transfer the vials to liquid nitrogen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PREPARATION OF FRESH CELLS FOR FLOW CYTOMETRY
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c4ltm","text":"The next steps will depend on the requirements for your specific panel. As an example, we have attached our 17-plex spectral cytometry panel that we routinely use on paediatric airway samples, as well as a publication describing the application of this panel. All of the following steps are related to this panel. steps.section: PREPARATION OF FRESH CELLS FOR FLOW CYTOMETRY
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4h6rn","text":"Following staining, wash cells with 2mL FACS buffer, centrifuge at    and resuspend cells in 200µL FACS buffer for acquisition on a flow cytometer (here, a Cytek 5L Aurora). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cnmfj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"400","duration":300,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"4","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

steps.section: PREPARATION OF FRESH CELLS FOR FLOW CYTOMETRY
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"55o37","text":"Immediately before running the sample, filter the cell suspension through a 35 µm cell strainer ( Falcon‱ 352235).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":104,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"82C27DDAE65C11EE92B00A58A9FEAC02","name":":tm:"}}}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF NASAL AND BRONCHIAL BRUSHINGS TO SINGLE CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8rskc","text":"Prepare cell suspension for cell counting. Here, we use AO/PI and the LUNA FL counter.  Remove 18µL for cell counting into a microcentrifuge tube. Add 2µL of AO/PI to the count tube and mix well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF NASAL AND BRONCHIAL BRUSHINGS TO SINGLE CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cvgmi","text":"Load 10µL of stained cells onto a Luna fluorescent counting slide and count. Record viability, total cell count, and live cell count. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4um2u","text":"If choosing to run flow cytometry or other single cell assays on fresh cells, here is where you can allocate the required number of cells for downstream processing. For flow cytometry, described below, we allocate 300,000 cells prior to proceeding to cryopreservation for remaining cells.
